content:
Diagnosis:	Grade I ganglioglioma of right temporal lobe

Management:	12 Jan 2023 Gross total resection
		BRAF V600E mutation detected

Histology:	WHO Grade I ganglioglioma

Current situation:	Routine surveillance

I reviewed [redacted name] in the neuro-oncology follow-up clinic today. He remains seizure-free on levetiracetam 750mg twice daily. His neurological examination is normal with no new focal deficits. Performance status remains 0.

Surveillance MRI brain performed on 15 March 2024 shows post-operative changes in the right temporal lobe with no evidence of disease recurrence. This is stable compared to previous imaging from September 2023.

The plan is to continue current anti-epileptic medication and arrange next surveillance MRI in 6 months. We will review him in clinic following this scan. He understands to contact us sooner if any new symptoms develop.

cancer_timeline.value: MRI brain shows post-operative changes, no evidence of recurrence, stable compared to September 2023

patient_facts.value: Normal neurological examination, no focal deficits

status_updates.value: WHO Grade I ganglioglioma status post gross total resection. Stable disease on surveillance with no clinical or radiological evidence of recurrence
Review in clinic following next MRI
